rule: Each category label should be followed by a colon and a single space before the list.
input: Text: Conversations featuring Malala Yousafzai and Greta Thunberg on impact investment.
output:
name: Extract Elements of Text
description: Extract specific elements of text from a given text
source: OpenAI documentation
url: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/6654000-best-practices-for-prompt-engineering-with-the-openai-api
inputs:
  text:
    type: string
---
Extract the important entities mentioned in the text below.

company_names: 
- Malala Yousafzai
- Greta Thunberg

people_names: 
- Malala Yousafzai
- Greta Thunberg

specific_topics: 
- Impact investment
- Malala Yousafzai
- Greta Thunberg

general_themes: 
- Activism
- Human rights 
- Sustainability
complianceText:
The output does not comply with the desired format stated in the description. According to the description, the format should involve listing company names, people names, specific topics, and general themes as comma-separated lists within specific headers in this order:

- Company names: <comma_separated_list_of_company_names>
- People names: -||-  
- Specific topics: -||-  
- General themes: -||-

Instead, the output lists each category as a bullet point list, which deviates from the specified desired format. Moreover, the "company_names" category seems to incorrectly list people names under it instead of company names, revealing non-compliance in content categorization according to the description's order as well.

ERR
